intro: Trimorpha glabrata, commonly known as the smoothleaf trimorpha, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its smooth, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
